ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Venril
ygData.msgSnippet: Agreed, I have often completely wiffed on an attack but had my Staff of Writhing blast it for 48 dmg (which is nice ;).  Not sure why Verant coded it that way
ygData.messageBody:
Agreed,

I have often completely wiffed on an attack but had my Staff of Writhing
blast it for 48 dmg (which is nice ;). Not sure why Verant coded it that
way but it is true. You can, and do, proc even if you don't hit your
opponent. And I've had mobs hit me but still proc their weapons... OUCH!!!
Y'kesha's are painful!

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath
<Travelers of Norrath>
Saryrn Server
----- Original Message -----
From: "J.R. Hyde" <junk@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, May 31, 2000 11:05 AM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Venril


> Err i get proc's all the time on npcs without even hitting them. I have my
> own misses off so i dont know if it was because they had a damage shield
or
> i just missed, but i didnt get any melee damage reported but i did get the
> non melee from the dagger proc.
>
> Dunno if this applies to npc's on pcs, but i do know pc's can proc on a
> damage shield/miss. You also get burned/pierced too.
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)" <garramone@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, May 31, 2000 7:30 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Venril
>
>
> > it's a proc. that's why the rune trick worked. if you do not hit the
> > target you can not proc. when you see a proc by a player who swung and
> > missed it's actually a hit for 0 damage.
> >
> > Shada Powa, L54 Wood Elf Minstrel
> > Tyria Sarkin, L50 High Elf Wizard
> > <Afterlife> Mithaniel Marr Server
> >
> >
> > > As far as strategy, all i can think of since mr didnt seem to
> > > do anything is
> > > figuring out whether his lifetap is a spell or a proc.
> >
